January.definition: Kindness means being caring and helpful to others.

quotes.quote: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: A warm smile is the universal language of kindness.
quotes.author: William Arthur Ward

quotes.quote: No act of kindness, however small, is ever wasted.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.quote: Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for kindness.
quotes.author: Seneca

questions: Why can even small acts of kindness make a big difference?
When someone was kind to you, how did it make you feel?
January.challenge: Do one kind action every day this month.

February.definition: Responsibility means taking care of your duties and doing what you should.

quotes.quote: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: The price of greatness is responsibility.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Responsibility is the thing people dread most of all.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Action springs not from thought, but from a readiness for responsibility.
quotes.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

questions: Why is it important to take responsibility without being asked?
What is one responsibility you want to improve at?
February.challenge: Master one household responsibility this month.

March.definition: Courage means doing what is right even when you feel scared.

quotes.quote: Courage is not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Fortune favors the bold.
quotes.author: Virgil

quotes.quote: Do the thing you fear and the death of fear is certain.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

questions: When did you last need courage?
Why does being brave sometimes feel uncomfortable?
March.challenge: Try one brave thing each week.

April.definition: Patience means staying calm while waiting or when something is difficult.

quotes.quote: Patience and fortitude conquer all things.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Genius is eternal patience.
quotes.author: Michelangelo

quotes.quote: Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.
quotes.author: Saadi

quotes.quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
quotes.author: Saint Augustine

questions: Why does patience help you learn?
What situations make patience hardest for you?
April.challenge: Practice one moment of calm breathing every day.

May.definition: Honesty means telling the truth and being trustworthy.

quotes.quote: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: No legacy is so rich as honesty.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Truth is the most valuable thing we have.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: The truth will set you free.
quotes.author: Jesus

questions: Why is honesty important in friendships?
Why do people sometimes avoid telling the truth?
May.challenge: Tell the truth quickly — not later.

June.definition: Integrity means doing the right thing even when no one is watching.

quotes.quote: Integrity is doing the right thing, even when no one is watching.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.quote: The time is always right to do what is right.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: Real integrity is doing the right thing, knowing nobody’s going to know whether you did it or not.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: To know what is right and not do it is the want of courage.
quotes.author: Confucius

questions: Why does integrity matter even when nobody sees?
What choices show integrity?
June.challenge: Do one 'secret good deed' each week.

July.definition: Gratitude means noticing and appreciating good things in your life.

quotes.quote: Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
quotes.author: Melody Beattie

quotes.quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.quote: The more grateful I am, the more beauty I see.
quotes.author: Mary Davis

quotes.quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues but the parent of all the others.
quotes.author: Cicero

questions: What is something small you are thankful for?
How does showing gratitude affect others?
July.challenge: Write one gratitude note each week.

August.definition: Empathy means understanding how someone else feels.

quotes.quote: Nobody cares how much you know until they know how much you care.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: I do not ask the wounded person how he feels, I myself become the wounded person.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: When people talk, listen completely.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

questions: How can you tell when someone needs support?
What does a good listener do?
August.challenge: Do one caring act each week.

September.definition: Perseverance means not giving up, even when something is hard.

quotes.quote: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th.
quotes.author: Julie Andrews

quotes.quote: Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
quotes.author: Confucius

questions: What skill do you want to practice more?
Why are mistakes part of learning?
September.challenge: Practice a goal 10 minutes each day.

October.definition: Respect means treating people and things with care.

quotes.quote: We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: Respect for ourselves guides our morals; respect for others guides our manners.
quotes.author: Laurence Sterne

quotes.quote: One of the most sincere forms of respect is actually listening.
quotes.author: Bryant H. McGill

quotes.quote: I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

questions: How can you show respect at home?
Why is listening part of respect?

November.definition: Citizenship means helping your family, school, community, and taking care of the planet we share.

quotes.quote: Ask not what your country can do for you—ask what you can do for your country.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors; we borrow it from our children.
quotes.author: Chief Seattle

quotes.quote: The greatest threat to our planet is the belief that someone else will save it.
quotes.author: Robert Swan

quotes.quote: What we do for ourselves dies with us. What we do for others and the world remains and is immortal.
quotes.author: Albert Pike

questions: What makes someone a good member of a community?
What is one thing you can do to help take care of the planet?
Why is it important for everyone to do their part?
November.challenge: Do one act each week that helps your community or the environment.

December.definition: Generosity means giving your time, help, or things to others.

quotes.quote: No one ever became poor by giving.
quotes.author: Anne Frank

quotes.quote: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

questions: Why is generosity sometimes hard?
What can you give that isn't money?
December.challenge: Give something each week — help, time, or kindness.
